required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Technology-Based Intervention for Reducing Sexually Transmitted Infections and Substance Use During Pregnancy
clinical_study.official_title: Technology-Based Intervention for Reducing Sexually Transmitted Infections and Substance Use During Pregnancy

collaborator.agency: Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD)

brief_summary.textblock: This proposed study is to test whether Health Check-up for Expectant Moms (HCEM), a computer-delivered screening and brief intervention (SBI) that simultaneously targets sexually transmitted infection (STI) risk and alcohol/drug use during pregnancy, reduces antenatal and postpartum risk more than an attention, time, and information matched control condition among pregnant women seeking prenatal care.

primary_outcome.description: Timeline Follow-Back (TLFB) is used to assess USOs which are sex-risk behaviors . The TLFB is a calendar assisted structured interview that provides a way to cue memory so that accurate recall is enhanced for event-level data; it has been used to assess sexual risk-taking. USOs will be assessed in the 90 days prior to the baseline, as well as the 8-week follow-up assessments.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of days of alcohol use measured by Timeline Follow-Back (TLFB)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days of alcohol use will be measured by the TLFB by using the variable of percent days abstinent.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of days of illicit drug use measured by Timeline Follow-Back (TLFB)
secondary_outcome.description: Illicit drug use will also be collected from the TLFB, and measured by using the "yes/no" variable for each day.

clinical_study.condition: Alcohol Use Complicating Pregnancy, Unspecified Trimester

arm_group.description: Theory-driven and derived from empirical support

intervention.description: A brief intervention (one session plus two booster sessions)
We will include facts about alcohol/drug use and risky sex during pregnancy, along with informational brochures that provide face validity.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- At least one unprotected vaginal (or anal) sex occasion in the past 30 days
- Pregnant
- Plan to deliver their baby at Michigan Medicine
- Current alcohol/drug use risk.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to understand English

responsible_party.investigator_title: Assistant Professor of Family Medicine and Assistant Professor of Psychiatry

patient_data.ipd_description: The study team does not currently have a plan to share data. However, the team is currently in discussion about sharing data and will update the registration as needed.
